claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling in tumors

evidence.quote: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling
Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings

claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination increases the fraction of tumor proteins represented in the immunopeptidome and MHC-I peptidome

evidence.quote: Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome | 62.3% | 37.3% | Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination
Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape

claims.caveat: The specific expansion magnitude may vary across different tumor models and the effect was strongest in specific model systems

claims.claim: Prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination is associated with improved survival in metastatic patients receiving ICI treatment

evidence.quote: Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely, and vaccination timing relative to ICI initiation varied across patients

claims.claim: Type I interferon signaling is necessary for the observed mRNA vaccine sensitization benefit

evidence.quote: Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit
Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase

claims.caveat: This causal dependency was demonstrated in mouse models and may not directly translate to all human tumor contexts

claims.claim: Combined intratumoral mRNA vaccination with checkpoint blockade improves tumor control compared to either monotherapy

evidence.quote: Vaccine-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models
ICI-only treatment had limited activity in low-immunogenic baseline settings

claims.caveat: The improved control was observed in preclinical murine models and requires prospective randomized studies before clinical protocol changes are justified
